title: Marissa Gill
text:
Welcome
Welcome to my website! My name is Marissa Gill and I am an undergraduate student at the University of California, Santa Barbara. I am currently pursuing degrees in both Hydrologic Science and Policy, and Geography with an Emphasis in Geographic Information Systems (GIS).


Areas of Interest
Stream Ecology | Groundwater | Surface-water | Water Policy and Management | Environmental Consulting | Geographic Information Systems | Habitat Reconstruction Efforts

title: About Me
text:
Academic Interests
My academic interests include water policy and management, watershed dynamics and the application of GIS to address environmental challenges in a visual way. I‚Äôm also gaining hands-on experience with tools like Microsoft Excel, ArcGIS, and R.


Campus Involvement
I am actively involved in the Hydrology club at UCSB, and serve as both treasurer and secretary on the Executive board. As a cofounder of the club in 2023 I work with the team to organize water-related events and connect with professionals in the field of hydrology on and off campus.


Outside the Classroom
In my personal time I love cooking new recipes and eating healthy and fufilling meals. I also love nature and dabble in landscape photography, especially since attending school near the ocean. I also love animals and on a free weekend like to visit the Santa Barbara Humane Society to adopt a dog and spoil them for the day!




My dog and I at the beach, Spring 2024.


Chicken coconut curry with vegetables and rice.


Photograph from a boat in Puerto Vallarta Mexico, Fall 2022.


Volunteering with the Santa Barbara Humane Shelter, taking a rescue out of the shelter for the day and on a walk.


Executive team of the Hydrology Club at UCSB presenting at the 55th Bren Hall Anniversary to faculty and alumni, Spring 2025.

About
text:
About Me
My academic interests include water policy and management and the application of GIS to solve real-world environmental issues. I‚Äôm currently working on a project that maps climate change impacts on groundwater aquifers across California. I‚Äôm also gaining hands-on experience with tools like ArcGIS, QGIS, R, and Python.

title: Supplemental Technical Work
text:
GIS Skills

Full spatial and statistical analysis of solar installations in the United States. Question 8 demonstrates ability to synthesize the data into a clear explanation of which socioeconomic and technical variables are most strongly associated with distributed PV adoption, how each variable correlates with installation rates, and what limitations arise due to spatial autocorrelation in the residuals ‚Äî highlighting that while the model identifies key predictors like EP_MINRTY and EP_NOHSDP, it may still miss important spatial factors influencing adoption patterns.



Experience using ModelBuilder in ArcGIS Pro to perform spatial analysis.

title: Supplemental Technical Work
text:
Hydrology Skills

Experience using Microsoft Excel to create Hydrographs, Rating Curves, Calculate discharge, Calculate recurrence intervals, and create Flood Frequency Curves.
